Dhruv Ji, Almost all of your videos more than 500 have been watched on by me along with my family and I'd like to thank you for providing wonderful knowledge about most of the things, or incidents which we weren't aware of or you can say even today we aren't. 

But I'd like to draw your attention towards the existence of Rama which has been an intriguing for most of scholars of the indian society. Could you please give some light on the birth of Rama in India with some archaeological proofs? Since all the temples existing in India have been modified with imaginary gods and goddess but couldn't hide the truth that all the temples have the touch of the time of Buddha. Why is it so? Regarding Prophet Muhammad я╖║ Splitting the moon.... 

Scientific reality is something created by Allah я╖╗ and the source of the QurтАЩan and Sunnah is Allah я╖╗ . 
Whatever comes from Allah я╖╗ тАУ whether it is revelation or creation тАУ cannot contradict one another, because here you are talking about Allahя╖╗, to Whom belongs utmost perfection and Whose knowledge encompasses all things, both major and minor. So He is far above there being any contradiction between what He creates and what He reveals, for they both come from the same source. 
Allah я╖╗, says in the Quran (interpretation of the meaning):

тАЬDo they not then consider the QurтАЩan carefully? Had it been from other than Allah, they would surely have found therein many contradictionsтАЭ
[an-NisaтАЩ 4:82].

Once you understand this idea, you will realise that whatever contradiction we think there is тАУ as it appears to be тАУ between scientific reality and prophetic hadith is due to errors in thinking, and the researcher must strive to examine and understand the issue in the light of the basic principle referred to above, the principle which confirms the harmony between reason (including empirical science) and revelation. Then he will realise that there was some mistake which led to what he thought was a contradiction. Otherwise, there is in fact agreement and harmony between reason and revelation (Quran and Hadees)... 

The researcher may realise that what he thought was a scientific fact in reality is not; rather science may reach a conclusion later on that is in harmony with the prophetic hadith, in which case there will be no basis for the claim of contradiction.

An example of that is when some people rejected the hadith of Abu Hurayrah ╪▒╪╢┘К ╪з┘Д┘Д┘З ╪╣┘Ж┘З about the fly, in which the Prophet Muhammad я╖║ said: тАЬIf a fly falls into the drink of one of you, let him immerse it then take it out, for on one of its wings is a disease and on the other is a cure.тАЭ Narrated by al-Bukhaari in his Saheeh (3320).

Some people criticised this hadith and said: How can that be so? How can both the disease and the cure be on the two wings of the fly? How could the fly know about that itself, so that it could put the diseased wing in first and try to avoid dipping the healing wing, and what is the flyтАЩs aim in doing that??? 

This objection to the hadith is hastening to reject it. But it became possible to respond to this criticism, as Some modern research has confirmed that the hadith of the fly actually has scientific proof, and that flies indeed carry disease in the form of harmful bacteria and they carry the remedy in the form of antibacterial agents. Among the strongest scientific evidence that has been established concerning this matter is research undertaken by Prof Dr Mustafa Ibraaheem Hasan, a professor in medical entomology and the director of the Centre for the Research and Study of Disease-Transmitting Insects, and published under the heading ad-DaaтАЩ waтАЩd-DawaтАЩ fi Janaahay adh-Dhubaab (Disease and Remedy on the Wings of the Fly).

Therefore it is not permissible for the researcher to be hasty in claiming that he knows scientific facts тАУ whether that is with regard to the alleged harm of immersing the fly in water, or any other issues тАУ before he verifies the matter by means of proper scientific experiments.

It should be known that hastening to reject any Quranic Ayah or Prophetic hadith is a very serious problem that usually leads to wrong conclusions. The hadith of the fly offers the greatest example to learn from in this regard.

A similar case is the hadith about the splitting of the moon. The scholars of hadith do not see any problem with believing in the incident of the splitting of the moon, and they have confirmed the soundness of many reports that were narrated concerning this incident.

One of the most significant of those reports is that which was narrated in as-Saheehayn from тАШAbdullah ibn MasтАШood ╪▒╪╢┘К ╪з┘Д┘Д┘З ╪╣┘Ж┘З who said: The moon was split in half at the time of the Messenger of Allah я╖║, and the Messenger of Allah я╖║ said: тАЬBear witness.тАЭ
This hadith was narrated by Imam al-Bukhaari in his Saheeh (no. 3636) and by Muslim in his Saheeh (2800). 

The hasty attitude on the part of some researchers, when they hasten to reject this hadith on the basis that it contradicts astronomical facts, is similar to the mistake mentioned above. 
That is because space science does not deny that the moon was split, and the fact that science does not confirm that it took place does not mean that it did not happen.
 
Therefore it is essential to subject the matter to proper scientific research, before deciding to interpret the hadith in a manner other than its apparent meaning, let alone rejecting it.

Brother, you have said about metaphorical issues...I agree with you in some context..but few things which is called "Mojeja" or "signs" just make clear you about that... It's not about science it's about signs..Prophets have those qualities.. It's seemed like impossible but if Allah wishes all possible..in their time it was usual because of lacking of knowledge of people to make them knowledgeable, Prophets pbut had to do so with the blessing of Allah... And orders form Allah were not for all the generations..It was for a particular generation.. Prophet Muhammad pbuh was sent for whole generation who were existing at that time and who are existing at this moment and who will exist in future..Allah sealed it with him...Quran is the final sealed scripture... Remember I didn't say only, I said final & sealed..before Quran many scriptures arrived..we can't deny, if denies then it will be Kufr..Let's come to the topic, Prophet Muhammad (pbuh) has the "Mojeja or Signs" which is Quran ..Even with the blessing of Allah, at one night he got the chance to visit from Makkah to Palestine (Masjidul Aqsa) and then to the 1st sky to the 7 th sky and was in a meeting with Allah SWT though there was light (nur), that's why he couldn't see Allah, but they had conversation..and back on earth in the dawn which seems like impossible but that happened...Another sign was when Non believers or Abu Jehel asked prophet to depart moon and they will believe Allah is one and only if Prophet pbuh can depart the moon. After hearing this, Prophet pbuh with the blessing of Allah departed the moon with his finger (not sword). In a journey with Sahaba, when there was a short of water, with the blessing of Allah when Prophet pbuh kept his hand under the water in a bowl, and shabas were drinking water, made obligation, or took bath, but the water was not finished, they saw water was pouring from the  middle of the fingers of Prophet pbuh and he kept his hand until the water needs fulfilled...there are more incidents happened about signs which I can tell...but I think those were the more crucial signs that can help you to understand....

No hateтАФI love all your videos. What you said in this video is exactly right, but I wanted to share my opinion, sir.

Hanuman is a god; he can do or lift anything.

If we look at the Hanuman Chalisa, written by Tulsidas in the 16th century, it clearly says:

"Ashta Siddhi Nava Nidhi Ke Data"

This means:

Ashta Siddhi - Eight powers:

Anima - The ability to reduce one's size to nano proportions
Mahima - The ability to increase one's size to gigantic proportions
Laghima - The ability to reduce weight to near zero
Garima - The ability to increase weight to an unbearable level
Prapti - The ability to become invisible
Prakamya - The ability to read thoughts
Ishatva - The ability to control air, water, fire, and metals
Vashitva - The ability to control living beings
Nava Nidhi - Nine types of wealth:

Kharva - Earthen vessel, baked in fire (good health)
Nila - Sapphire (money)
Kunda - Jasmine flower (beauty)
Mukunda - Grains (food)
Kachapa - Tortoise (home)
Makara - Alligator (wisdom)
Shankha - Conch (time)
Padma - Lotus (integrity)
Mahapadma - Bluish white lotus (children)
So, he can do anything.

The distance between the Sun and Earth was disclosed in 1673 as 93,000,000 miles (148,800,000 kilometers) according to scientists.

However, the Hanuman Chalisa, written between 1500-1600, states "Yug Sahasra Yojana Par Bhanu":

Yug = 12,000 years
Sahasra = 1,000
Yojana = 8 miles
So, Yug x Sahasra x Yojana = 12,000 x 1,000 x 8 miles = 96,000,000 miles

Where 1 mile = 1.6 kilometers

96,000,000 miles x 1.6 kilometers = 153,600,000 kilometers to the Sun.

So, this is my view. I love all your content; keep it up, sir.

That being said I suggest you look more into the evidences for Christianity. Unlike other religions, Christianity have a solid base of eye witness accounts of the miracles performed by Jesus. He claimed to be God, died and rose from the dead as he prophesied. This is proven by the fact that there are hundreds of instances of Jesus appearing to believers and non believers at the time, notably St  Paul, who had tortured Christians up until that point. 

  We also have evidences from historians of that time, Josephus and Tacitus that Jesus was a wonder worker. His apostles had nothing to gain from claiming their teacher was God. 11 of them met their demise after brutal torture. 

  Jesus fulfilled hundreds of prophesies in the old testament, including his birth, his public ministry, and the manner of his death. We have evidenses of these from dead sea scrolls.

He was loving, yet he was harsh when he needed to be, he spoke out against the evil of his time and prophesied that he will return for the final Judgement.

 He had to die for our sins, as the perfect lamb of God, since no humans were perfect. God being perfect came down on earth to bear the sins of the world. 

 So I would suggest to listen what this man had to say.

Particularly referencing Prophet Muhammad's alleged use of a sword in this event. I appreciate your efforts to discuss historical and religious narratives, but I feel compelled to clarify some misconceptions presented in your video.

Firstly, you mentioned that Prophet Muhammad ( peace be upon him) split the moon with a sword. However, it is important to note that neither the Quran nor the Hadith mention the use of a sword in this miraculous event. The Quranic account simply states that the moon split as a sign from Allah (Quran, 54:1-3).

Secondly, the splitting of the moon is not a mythological story but a well-documented miracle mentioned in the Quran. The Quranic verses (54:1-3) clearly describe this event as a sign from Allah, which some people witnessed but still rejected as sorcery due to their disbelief. the event of the splitting of the moon is mentioned in the Quran in Surah Al-Qamar (54:1-3), where it is described as a miracle and a sign from Allah. This event is not presented as a mythological story but as a divine miracle.
Furthermore, the splitting of the moon is considered a miracle because it defied the laws of nature. This event is not comparable to normal occurrences and should be understood in its miraculous context.

Thirdly, The Quranic verses describing the splitting of the moon indicate a miraculous event. They are narrated in the context of events that have already occurred, suggesting that the effects of this event could possibly still exist or may not, as it was a unique miracle that visibly defied the laws of nature.

Lastly, scientifically, it's important to note that as of today, neither NASA nor ISRO, nor any other institution or individual, has complete knowledge of the entire surface of the moon. Claiming definitively that no such event of the moon splitting ever occurred is, therefore, an unlettered approach, as there could be parts of the moon that have not been fully explored or understood. 

It is important to ensure that the information presented in videos, especially regarding religious matters, is accurate and well-researched. Misrepresenting religious beliefs can be hurtful and disrespectful to those who hold them sacred.

Ram is real?

Hello Dhruv,
belated Happy Holi.
I have a different opinion here about Uttara Kanda which was composed by Rishi Valmiki and this is backed by facts from Valmiki Ramayana and other sources. 

I watch your YT videos on different topics from time to time and greatly appreciate the amount of research effort that goes into making these videos.

Recently I came across this video, The Truth about Ramayan which is dealing with the question - whether Uttara Kanda is part of original Valmiki Ramayana or is it a later addition. There are different topics discussed in the video that are from Uttara Ramayana but without going into those here I just want to focus on the question whether Uttara Kanda is part of original Valmiki Ramayana or is it a later addition. In my view this video primarily relies on last chapter of Yuddha Kanda and also some specific inconsistencies in the Valmiki Ramayana to conclude that Uttara Kanda is a later addition by others and not authored by Rishi Valmiki. If fact, there are many inconsistencies in the Valmiki Ramayana but that should not be the basis of deciding on this critical question.

If we carefully check the contents of Valmiki Ramayana then weтАЩll find that Rishi Valmiki himself is the author of Uttara Ramayana and Uttara Kanda is very much part of Valmiki Ramayana. IтАЩm providing different references below to establish that claim.

IтАЩm using following Valmiki Ramayana sources as reference.
1. Srimad Valmiki Ramayana by Gita Press
2. Valmiki Ramayana - Developed and Maintained by IIT Kanpur
3. The Ramayana of Valmiki by Hari Prasad Shastri

1st evidence - If we check Bala Kanda chapter 4, slokas 1 to 6 and specifically slokas 2 and 3 then it is crystal clear that Rishi Valmiki himself is the author of Uttara Kanda leaving no room for further debate. 

One key point to note here is that slokas 4 to 6 are talking about Lava and Kusa and how Rishi Valmiki initiated them into Ramayana. Lava and KusaтАЩs birth is only mentioned in Uttara Kanda, not in 6 other Kandas.

Uttara Kanda reference in The Mahabharata - 
Under Vana Parva as part of Draupadiharana Parva in chapters 272 to 290 Rishi Markandeya while narrating Ramayana to Yudhisthira narrated at length about Ravana as part of the prologue that belongs to Uttara Kanda. 

If we try to discard this fact then arenтАЩt we saying that part of Mahabharata is incorrect?

Uttara Kanda reference in Padma Purana - 
Patala Khanda chapters 1 to 68 provide details from Uttara Kanda at lenght.

Shristi Khanda chapters 33 to 37 provide details of certain incidents from Uttara Kanda.

If we try to discard these facts then arenтАЩt we saying that part of Padma Purana is incorrect?

In addition to that in Uttara Kanda chapter 94, slokas 23 to 28 Lava and Kusa while answering to Ram gives same details about Ramayana and specifically Uttara Kanda that we find in Bala Kanda chapter 4.

Gita Press - Uttara Kanda chapter 94, slokas 23 to 28:

Desirous to know the composer of that poem, Sri Rama, the mighty one, asked both of those two ascetics: (23)

тАШHow long is this poem? What is the object of the noble one, Valmiki? Where is the composer of this poem, the best among asceticsтАЩ. (24)

The two sons of ascetic said to the scion of Raghu, тАЬThe venerable sage Valmiki is the composer who has come to this place of performance. By this poem he has revealed the whole lifeтАЩs account to you.тАЭ (25)


тАШTwenty-four thousand slokas (verses) with a hundred legends have been composed by the ascetic, Bhargava Valmiki, the brother of Bhrgu. (26)

тАШFrom the beginning, O King, five hundred cantos with six Kandas (parts) together with the Uttara (best Kanda) have been composed by the noble one, our preceptor, sage Valmiki, keeping in mind your lifeтАЩs deeds which will continue till all beings live. (27-28)

point about sanatan dharma:---
we believe in "karma:--  sum of good and bad deeds"
only religion which believe in reincarnation and our karma affects reincarnation in next life.
oldest religion of the world with no one knowing who and when started.

our end goal is moksha:-- connecting to divinity within ourself and break the cycle of reincarnation.
only religion with multiverse concept and very detain and most accurate data about universe , and it's creations.

fun fact :- you can choose to worship god or choose not to worship in hinduism and still be hindu as long as you believe above things and few more things.

Once Parvati ji asked Mahadev ji on the basis of which knowledge everyone in the world worships you as Shiva.  Put on deerskin and put on all your limbs a cremation vibhuti, wearing a garland of snakes and male heads around your neck.  None of these are holy, then what knowledge are you considered holy?  Then Mahadeva replied, O dear listen, the knowledge of the Gita is considered sacred by holding it in your heart.  This knowledge does not concern me with external actions.  Then Parvati ji said that O God, the knowledge of the Gita that you praise so much, is there any merit in listening to it?  Mahadev replied that by hearing this knowledge many living beings have become grateful and will continue to do so.  I tell you an ancient story.  you listen

Bhai, this is true that we all should learn Ram's values. But I would recommend that you also read a book "Gandhi vadh kyun" - by Nathuram Godse. This book is not written by Nathuram but it is a script of the speech which Nathuram gave on the final day of his judgement in the court. Govt. of India had put a ban on print and sale of this book since 1948 until a few years ago. That will clear the perspective on Nathuram, why he touched Gandhi's feet before shooting him at point blank range. Whether Nathuram was a villain or a patriot who knew what he was doing, and how future generations would perceive him as?

@dhruvrathee  Interesting video, there are few points that i disagree with but i want to address the most important issue, the confusion on interchanging the word 'Dharma' with Religion.  Ideally  Religion from what we see today  parallel Hindi word would be 'Sampraday'. The ancient texts when speak of Dharm  like 'dharm sansthapana dyay'  'dharme rakshti'  here texts are not asking you to protect religion but Dharma. Dharma is virtue, dharma is ideal practice. and if we go by Mahabharat and Krishna, Dharma is Dynamic , its subject to change depending on situation.   If this confusion is cleared I feel most of the conflicts will be resolved.

Again  about your quote " Ram-Nathuram" . I feel that you have mixed up 2 different theories.  Faith and Civilization.   

when we talk about faith, Yes it is personal. and everything rosy and good.
When we talk about Civilization a small question:  will Iran respect Persian civilization roots?  Will Egypt respect or  follow Ancient Egyptian practices?
The best example  of Irony about Civilization and  Faith that leads to existential crisis is Pakistan.  Their official governments site claims that they are the inheritors of Indus Civilization. They are the founders. They hold pride in the society that lived for 3000 yrs. Yet they destroyed Pralhadpuri Temple( much ancient, historically significant than Babri Masjid)   in Multan when Babri Masjid was demolished in Ayodhya.

I hope you realize the difference in concepts. I would be glad if you can make a video on clarification of these concepts

Few things to clear:

1. Existence of phalshruti after yudhkand does not mean valmiki ramayan ended there. Mahabharat has phalshruti after chapters, many other granth have phashruti after chapter. So if uttarkand is addition based on phashruti after yudhkand then all other granth also become additions. 

2. When kuber messanger went to vibhishan, vibhishan introduced him to ravan as it was right fir him to address him. he gave message of kuber to Ravan which he did not like and Ravan killed him in his anger with his own hands with sword in one blow. Ravan did not gave any order to his mantri to kill him in his anger. He was so angry because in his messgae kuber said has befriended lord shiv who agrees of misdeeds of Ravan. Ravan did not like this at all as he worshiped lord shiv. So became so angry that he killed messanger with his hands in one blow. It is not mentioned that vibhishan was there at that time. May be may be not

In sunderkand when hanuman was captured he with humility identified himself as messanger of ram and asked ravan to return Sita. By abducting her he has done wrong. Ravan did not took hanuman nor Ram seriously and therefore he in his arrogance gave order to kill hanuman to his mantri. It is specifically mentioned vibhishan was there at that time order was given. So this time he had opportunity to argue with ravan. He explains to ravan that he should not kill messanger as it is not right as per shastra to kill a messanger. He is a mighty king he should be happy and not do this sin. When ravan said he is his enemy and killing enemy is not wrong as per dharam. Then vibhishan explains him that shastra are clear that one should not kill messanger. One can punish him by beating him with hunter, make him handicap but he has not heard of killing punishment for mesaamger. So vibhishan here is mentioning that he has not heard a killing punishment for messanger in shastra not that he has not heard that ravan has ever killed a mesaamger. He trying to convince him to not commit this sin/crime. 

3. Metaphoric nature of stories. It is true that scriptures and stories are metaphoric in nature. And stories do use atishiyokti alankar in story telling. But to disregard the importance of literature that it is all hiped and not real is also wrong. Hanuman ne phal samajhkar surya ko bhale na khaya ho, 500 varsh purani likhi chalisa ye zaroor btatai hai ki agar dharti se ud kar surya tak jaoge to 93 million km ka safar tey karna hoga "yug sahastra yojan par bhanu, lilyo tahi madhur ohal janu" 

It is possible that story in some way is metaphoric when saying hanuman flew, he grew his size and lifted a mountain to bring herb to lanka. But it is also possible that story is hinting possible air travel of that time. We know that sri lanka has a place where vegitation is different from local island ecosystem. We know ancient time had vimaan. So scripture or story ki greatness is baat se kaam nahi hoti agar usme atishyokti ka use bhi kiya gya. Maharanapratap 360 kilo utha kar bhale nayi lade lekin 35 kg uthakar bhi unhone invaders ka samna kiya. Usse unki mahanta main koi kami nahi aati. Atishyokti saundrya alankaar hai. Wo basha main samvaad ke saundrya ko badata hai. Na ki mithya ki samvad ki reality khatam karta. Ladki ko mrignayani ya apsara kaha jata iska matlab ye nahi ki wo normal si dikhti thi bas atishyokti lga ke zada sunder bna diya. Iska matlab wo sach mai  bahaut sunder thi or us bhaav ko basha mai darshane ke liye atishyokti lagaya gya. 

Utar kaand ko alag se juda batana, ya uske andar diye sandesh ko milavat kehna un logo ka kaam hai jo chahte hai ki hum apne he grantho ko milavati samjhe, Sirf kahaniya bta kar unki greatness ko kam aanke. Unke message ko mod tod kar logo samjhaya jaye or unhe kaha jaye tum bewakoof ho ko padte nahi. Geeta main shri krishan swayam kehte hai ki sansaar main varn vayawastha karm or gun ke adhaar par banayi gayi hai. Ek brahman apne gun or karm ke adhar par brahman hota.  Isi liye jitne bhi purane photograph or paintings dekh lo kumhaar, tarkhan, sunyara sab janeyu dhaari the na ki sirf brahman. Shambu ek shudra tha jo tap kar raha tha swarglok par vijay paane ki. Ram ne uska vadh kiya uske gun or karam ke adhar par na ki shudra jone ki vajah se. 

Rathee jaise logo ki na sune, garv kare apne sanatan itihas par or is mitti ke sanskriti par. Ye wo kathaye hai jo sunati he nayi balki pramaan hai ki jab duniya, ishwar ke naam par katal kar rahi thi, jab sabhyata karwat lena seekh rahi thi, indian subcontinent ki civilization jisne sanatan vichardhara ko janam duya, baad main hindu ka naam mila wo daud rahi thi. Jai shree raja ram
